title: It's OK to be deaf
creator_contributor_role: Institute of Educational Administration, production company
subject_group: Food, Health, Lifestyle, Medicine, Psychology & Safety/Children, Deaf
Education, Instruction, Teaching & Schools/Mainstreaming in education
Family, Gender Identity, Relationships & Sexuality/Children, Deaf
description: Records the attempts by the mother of a profoundly deaf student to obtain adecuate schooling for her daughter within a normal school environment. Underlines the importance in particular of not treating children with hearing impairment as different from children without hearing impairments.
